info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:25PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Sierra County through 700 PM MDT... At 625 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Truth or Consequences, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Truth or Consequences, City of Elephant Butte, Rock House, North Monticello Point, Alamosa Canyon, Williamsburg, Elephant Butte Lake, Lost Canyon, Ash Canyon, Rock Canyon, Hot Springs Landing, Lakeshore Highlands and South Monticello Campground. This includes Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 71 and 88, and between mile markers 90 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
